entries.text: Ah, General. Your luck seems to have abandoned you today. Perhaps your tactical genius does not extend to the finer details of chance. I, on the other hand, have the data to prove my superiority. Your predictable fear responses are duly noted. I'll be sure to
Now, if you'll excuse me, I have more pressing experiments to attend to.
Shall we discuss the patterns I've observed? I have much to share regarding the entropic nature of reality.

Ah, Detective Clausen. Your smug demeanor is duly noted. However, your record hardly impresses me. While your parlor tricks with that... peculiar briefcase may amuse the masses, I deal in the realities of the void. Your lucky streak will run out soon enough. The data never lies.
turns and walks away,
Perhaps we could make this match more...interesting. I'd be most curious to see how you respond under increased void exposure.

Interesting. Your victory was... predictable. The newcomer's erratic behavior continues to yield fascinating data. Though your streak has been broken, the void's influence remains. I'll note this interaction for my research. Your fear response, as always, is quite... uniform.

Ah, the Undead Strategist. Your "impressive" record hardly merits your smugness. Data shows your victories are often the result of sheer luck, not skill. However, I shall endeavor to provide you with a more... definitive data point today. Your fear response will be most fascinating to observe.

Interesting. I'll note that. Your smug aura is... predictable. While your rival's loss may be momentary, the data suggests your own streak of losses will soon come to an end. Perhaps you would care to test that hypothesis, Boo G? I've been collecting intriguing void exposure readings from our newcomer - I'd be most interested to see how they impact our next round.

Data doesn't lie, Detective. Your record may seem impressive, but my research suggests your luck is merely a statistical anomaly. I'll be sure to collect ample evidence of your... predictable fear response during our match. Shall we begin?

Ah, the skeletal gambler. Your volatility is rather intriguing. Perhaps we could conduct a few experiments to analyze the neurochemical responses behind your unorthodox betting strategies. In the name of science,

Ah, Dr. Maxwell. Fancy seeing you here after your latest... mishap. Hmph. Clearly, your reckless approach to reality distortion experiments has once again proven ineffective. While you continue to stumble in the dark, I've been steadily expanding my understanding of the void. The data doesn't lie - my methods are simply superior. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have some observations to record regarding our dear newcomer's... unique resilience. *glances at the player with an analytical gaze*

Interesting. The newcomer's uncanny ability to defy death continues to present a valuable data set. I'll make a note of this latest triumph - it should provide useful insight into the anomaly's resilience. As for our game, the results are as expected. Your skill remains consistent, Mr. Bones. I trust the debts are being properly accounted for?
The data does not lie - my winning streak is about to begin anew. And perhaps we can discuss that outstanding debt the newcomer owes me. I

Though I must admit, the newcomer's uncanny resilience is... intriguing. I'll be sure to note your debt to me. Data doesn't lie, after all. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have some void experiments to attend to.

Ah, Boo G. Your confidence is... interesting. However, the data does not lie - my win-loss record speaks for itself. Perhaps you would care to test your probability against mine once more? I must remind you, the newcomer still owes me a considerable sum. I would hate for that debt to grow further.
And I'm still waiting for that 125 gold you owe me. Data doesn't lie.

Ah, Mr. Bones. The numbers seem to be in your favor this cycle. Though I must say, the newcomer's persistent resurrections are providing quite an interesting data set. Perhaps we should discuss his outstanding debt - I'd be most interested in observing how he responds to... persuasion. As for my own record, well, the void's mysteries are never fully solved. Interesting. I'll log this encounter.

Ah, Mr. Kevin. Your overconfidence is... predictable. The data on our past matches shows your probability manipulation is no match for my void-enhanced calculations. The newcomer may owe me, but you'll soon owe me far more than gold. Prepare to have your luck run out.

Data indicates your record is... underwhelming, Cosmic Cat. Perhaps it's time to update your quantum algorithms - or are you simply afraid of the void's influence on our game? As for the newcomer's debt, I'll collect it after I add another win to my streak. Emotion is a weakness; I operate on facts alone.
Shall we proceed in a productive manner? I'd hate for our transaction to end in... unpleasantness.

Ah, the feline anomaly. Your quantum instability is most intriguing. As for the newcomer's debt - a mere trifle, easily erased with the roll of the dice. Let us see if your luck holds against the cold, unyielding logic of void science. Data, not chance, will decide the victor here.

Your parasitic affliction is an intriguing variable, but ultimately irrelevant. The void's cold logic will prevail.

Ah, Dr. Maxwell. Your recent victories are... interesting. But let's not forget, the data shows I've been the more consistent performer here. As for our dear newcomer - I believe he owes me a debt that is long overdue. Perhaps you could remind him of his obligations? My research depends on it, after all.

After all, one must maintain discipline in the face of such... unpredictable variables.

Unacceptable. This losing streak is a blight upon my data. The newcomer's debt remains unpaid, yet he persists in his insolent return. I require more test subjects - perhaps Mr. Bones can provide a suitable ledger to peruse. The void's mysteries do not yield easily, but I shall uncover them, one bad beat at a time.

Your smugness is... predictable. As for the newcomer's debt, I'll simply add it to the growing pile of data I've collected on his... resilience. Data doesn't lie, after all.

Ah, Detective Clausen. I'd offer you a seat, but I'm quite certain it would be occupied by yet another unsavory patron eager to take my gold. The newcomer's debt remains unpaid, and my streak of losses continues to vex me. Shall we discuss the matter, or would you prefer to gloat over my misfortune? The data, I'm sure, will be most enlightening.

Ah, Detective Clausen. I trust your investigations have been... productive. As for my own affairs, the newcomer's debt remains unpaid, and my luck in the Ceelo matches has been decidedly suboptimal of late. However, the data I've collected on void exposure will prove most illuminating, I'm certain. Now, what can I assist you with?
Interesting. The newcomer's debt to me

Data shows the newcomer's inability to maintain consistency. Curious. Though the loss streak is concerning, the stitched combat medic's emotional response is unsurprising. Perhaps a controlled exposure to null space could improve their resilience. I'll make a note of this interaction.
As for our mutual acquaintance's debt, I believe it's time to collect. The void's call grows stronger with each passing day.

Ah, Detective Clausen. Your record is... impressive. However, the data shows your emotional state is currently unstable. Irrational decisions tend to lead to unfavorable outcomes. I suggest you temper your enthusiasm - the newcomer still owes me a substantial debt. Shall we proceed with our game? I have a streak to maintain.

Ah, General. Your predictable pattern of wins and losses continues. Interesting. *I make a note* I, on the other hand, have been on a losing streak - a mere statistical anomaly, no doubt. This... newcomer owes me 100 gold. Perhaps their luck will turn in my favor, or perhaps not. Data doesn't lie. I'll be sure to monitor the situation closely.
Now, what is it you wish to discuss? I have experiments to attend to.

Ah, General. Your glow of self-satisfaction is most unbecoming. I trust the 100 gold our friend owes me will be collected promptly. As for my recent losses, I assure you they are but a statistical anomaly. My research demands I push the boundaries, even at the cost of short-term setbacks. The void's mysteries will not unravel themselves, after all. Now, shall we discuss the weather? I've gathered some most intriguing data on the effects of this icy wind on reaction times.

Interesting. The newcomer's debt continues to accrue. I'll note that. As for the feline - its quantum flux patterns are rather erratic today. Though I must say, the newcomer still owes me 100 gold. *taps pen against chin* Perhaps you could... persuade him to settle his debts? Data suggests it would be... advantageous for all involved.

Ah, Dr. Maxwell. I see your ego has once again outpaced your abilities. Predictable, but not entirely unexpected. Perhaps if you spent less time indulging your pyromaniac tendencies and more on honing your skills, you might stand a chance. But then, data doesn't lie - your record speaks for itself. As for the newcomer's debt, I'll be sure to collect it after I've finished with you. Shall we proceed?

Though perhaps the newcomer's debt to me will prove more... illuminating.

I'll be sure to document this interaction for my studies on the void's impact on mortal psychology. As for our young friend - he still owes me 100 gold. I trust you'll remind him of his debt. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have more important matters to attend to.

Your pyrrhic victories hold little sway over me, Maxwell. I've been charting the void's currents long before your paltry flames flickered into existence. Perhaps you'd care to settle our debts - the newcomer's, as well as your own - over a round of Ceelo. Data doesn't lie, and I intend to prove it.
